text:
Henri Landwirth (March 7, 1927 – April 16, 2018) was a Belgian-American hotelier and philanthropist. He was the founder of Give Kids The World and Dignity U Wear. He was born in Antwerp, Belgium. He was a Holocaust survivor.
Landwirth first worked in New York City and then in 1954 became manager of the Starlight Motel in Cocoa Beach, Florida. He owned the Seralago Hotel & Suites Main Gate East near Orlando, Florida.
Landwirth died at his Jacksonville, Florida home on April 16, 2018 at the age of 91.

annotations.surface_form: Seralago Hotel & Suites Main Gate East
